title: Speaking the Right Language: The Impact of Expertise Alignment in User-AI Interactions
author: Shramay Palta (University of Maryland, College Park), Nirupama Chandrasekaran (Microsoft Research), Rachel Rudinger (University of Maryland, College Park), Scott Counts (Microsoft Research)
relevance_why: Understanding expertise alignment in user interactions with AI could enhance the design of AI systems, which is relevant to improving user interaction in audio and speech applications.
field: Social and Economic Aspects of ML-Human-AI Interaction
background: This paper investigates how the expertise of users and AI agents impacts user satisfaction and engagement during conversations.
contribution: This paper introduces an ordinal expertise classifier to assess user and AI expertise levels, exploring the relationship between expertise alignment and user experience metrics.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous studies inadequately addressed the influence of user expertise on interactions with AI, often focusing on performance metrics without considering user satisfaction.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work contributes a multi-dimensional analysis of user experience by integrating expertise alignment into user satisfaction evaluation.

key_innovation: Combines user and AI expertise assessments to provide insights into how expertise gaps affect satisfaction and engagement in conversations.
real_world_impact: Improving user-AI interaction design could lead to enhanced productivity and user satisfaction across applications in various fields, including education and healthcare.
limitations: The study's findings are based on predicted expertise labels, which may introduce bias, and the results are limited to English conversations.

new_terms.expertise alignment: **Expertise alignment** refers to the matching levels of knowledge and skills between users and AI systems, which influences user interactions and satisfaction.
